name: fuckyoufriday
text: Beef is so elated by Ray's brutal Marmaduke smackdown he looks like he's tripping. Like if your 6 year old nephew got dosed with LSD while Santa gave him a Playstation 12.

name: biiaru
text: A comment left by biiaru was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by theoddwaffle, Overmedicated, TonyHighwind, StagnantDisplay, anticitizen, LordPretzel, mustconcentrate)

name: overmedicated
text:
Welcome to Pe'dants Corner.

(Anyone who doesn't recognise the apostrophe reference is not a Private Eye reader and therefore unworthy of my time.

name: overmedicated
text: Touche, Carlton.

name: heccibiggs
text: Can I just say that your current avatar is like exactly in time with the printer in my office.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: damn. i wants me a ps12. guess i better start writing Santa more often.

name: ravindra108
text: He kind of resembles to his future brother-in-law, Taffy .

name: untilyouaresonude
text: A comment left by untilyouaresonude was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Pinefresh, Spoon, hemp_fandango, tttt2, chaesar, dj)

name: deimosrising
text: Ray demonstrating his insult skills again. Really when you are this good at what you do turning on your nephew is kind of abusive.

name: arcibi
text: I must admit that I did not know it was possible to do that much coke

name: dropkickpikachu
text: Marmaduke is some kind of masochist, though. All reluctant to hang up.

name: slab64
text: Seriously! I bet Marmaduke even lets telemarketers finish their spiel before politely asking them not to call during dinner (6-7pm).

name: dusty
text: I had a telemarketer call back after being asked to stop so many times that i just tried breathing heavily into the phone, all like "HURRF HAAAH HURRRF", it seemed like he stayed on going "sir, sir, can you hear me sir?" for an awfully long time. I think they get demerits if they hang up first or something.

name: tekende
text: They're technically not allowed to be the one to end the call unless they're being threatened, and I think even then they have to end with the usual "please call bla bla bla if you have any questions" or whatever. Policies may vary from company to company though.

name: thegoblins
text: I'm pretty sure telemarketers are not allowed to hit on the people they call, either.  People in general, and perhaps telemarketers in particular, do a lot of things they aren't allowed to do.

name: tekende
text: Yeah, that's why I said "technically".

name: dumase
text: secretly, he knows he deserves it

name: videodromehank
text: Check this: http://marmadukeexplained.blogspot.com/

name: alejandroadam
text: this is mad awesome

name: evolume
text: that is really quite brilliant

name: cousinted
text: Marmaduke recieves a prank phonecall from a cat in a thong and warm-ups.

name: kledermans
text: I thought at first that your username ended in Ome Henk.  That it does not is indeed disappointing.

name: mattylite
text: In the old days being lazy had to do with not actually getting up and stuff.  Now it has to do with being unwilling to open another tab on firefox and google the thing you just read that confused you.  Which is to say I was gonna lame you but then I looked up Ome Henk, and decided: a.) Dutch, and Dutch people, are weird, and b.) chubby.

name: onepapertiger
text: simply beautiful

name: shatneresque
text:
New web address for Marmaduke Explains.

It is yonder.

name: shatneresque
text:
HAHA YES I TOTALLY MEANT TO SAY THAT.
MARMADUKE EXPLAINS IT ALL.
Oh God

name: nurdbot
text: I love how Ray plants the seed of failure into him, and the fact that old dog can't hang up.

name: tinhand
text: The look on Roast Beefs face in the last panel is a nice touch.

name: nathanielperson
text: He looks happier there than he does on the 5.

name: semiquaver
text: A 5 does not make Roast Beef happy.  Less than 5 makes Roast Beef increasingly sad.

name: djwhiterabbit
text: the small aside of "ssssh!" is the subtle gold of this strip.

name: darthemed
text: First Achewood I ever saw. Hooked as soon as I finished it.

name: aaron_haynes
text: "People whisper about this to each other!" is such a vague line, yet it says so very much.

name: toughasnails001
text: I imagine Marmaduke's voice to sound like Robert from Everybody Loves Raymond.

name: euphemisms
text: "i'll give you a hint: you should not be proud of your career!" is one of my favourite lines in all of achewood. i don't quite know why, but it hits a nerve.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: I'm partial to "I am Marmaduke. You do not speak to me in this way", all in a quavery voice.

name: swatson
text:
http://wondermark.com/tcsd/stripdoc_6.html

You will never look at Marmaduke the same again. I promise. PROMISE.

name: bixschmix
text: A comment left by bixschmix was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by saddestking, fakead, gnjdfsgk)

name: swatson
text:
not even a little funny? no?

well I like it. :(

name: layzerblade
text: I chuckled a couple of times, but I found it to be more snarky than analytical. The best of these Internet rant/essays go on for thousands of words, and show that the author has immersed himself into the world of what they're analyzing more than any rational person would imagine doing. This one's just spliced together from one interview and a few comics cherrypicked to fit the thesis. It comes off as a punk kid mocking an old man about whom he knows comparatively little.

name: hereward
text:
Reconstituted from where? It's pretty clear the writer thought up those ideas on their own, and whether you like it or not, there's at least a little truth in them; there must be reasons why such a crappy strip has survived this long. And see the 'dry humping' example from the above 'marmaduke explained' thing.

The article isn't funny though, however true..

name: mattylite
text: Jesus, that article finds some rough chuckles in Marmaduke.

name: troy_convers
text: I think the writer REALLY needs to get say, a life instead of expending energy on a twee but inoffensive comic strip.

name: troy_convers
text: I think the writer REALLY needs to get say, a life instead of expending energy on a twee but inoffensive comic strip.

name: troy_convers
text: I think the writer REALLY needs to get say, a life instead of expending energy on a twee but inoffensive comic strip.

name: tekende
text: You seem pretty convinced of this.

name: snowman
text:
Hee hee! Oh, hee hee!

If I could, I would rate this a 9.

name: chachibenji
text: In a surprise twist, he doesn't hang up until Ray finishes off by telling Marmaduke about how his drug abuse gave him Marmaduke Milk which tasted like old crung.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
beef's laughing in panel four is hilarious.


and the end.

name: norsef
text:
Maybe it's just because I grew up with Great Danes but I actually like Marmaduke.

They really are very big.

name: tonyhighwind
text: Every strip of Ray insulting his funny papers "contemporaries" deserves a higher rating than they have.  They are all sheer brilliance.

name: carlyle
text: It's the 5 Face!

name: thetimbrown
text: I never expected Marmaduke to sound so...academic. I'm imagining a John Malkovich-esque voice for some reason.
